intro: Siphocampylus calodontus, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats and has hairy stems and leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Siphocampylus calodontus is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
